qas.question: Beyonce had an all-female tour band whose name was what?
Beyonce had singers in the background known by the name as?
The Mamas members included which 3 musicians?

answers.text: Montina Cooper-Donnell, Crystal Collins and Tiffany Moniqué Riddick

qas.question: The Mamas first appearance was when?
What band did Beyonce introduce in 2006?
What song name does the band Suga Mama  and a song on the B'Day album share?
Where did Suga Mama band make their first appearance?
What band supports Beyonce in her tours?
What is the name of Beyoncé's female tour band?
Suga Mama is also a song on which Beyoncé album?
What are Beyoncé's backup singers called?
When did The Mamas make their debut?

context: In <a3_0>2006<a3_0/>, Beyoncé introduced her all-female tour band <a0_0><a4_0><a5_0><a7_0><a8_0>Suga Mama<a8_0/><a7_0/><a5_0/><a4_0/><a0_0/> (also the name of a song in <a9_0>B'Day<a9_0/>) which includes bassists, drummers, guitarists, horn players, keyboardists and percussionists. Her background singers, <a1_0><a10_0>The Mamas<a10_0/><a1_0/>, consist of <a2_0>Montina Cooper-Donnell, Crystal Collins and Tiffany Moniqué Riddick<a2_0/>. They made their debut appearance at <a11_0>the <a6_0>2006 BET Awards<a11_0/><a6_0/> and re-appeared in the music videos for "Irreplaceable" and "Green Light". The band have supported Beyoncé in most subsequent live performances, including her 2007 concert tour The Beyoncé Experience, 2009–2010 I Am... World Tour and 2013–2014 The Mrs. Carter Show World Tour.
